reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI was an avid PS Home user since 2008 and see a lot of the spirit of PS Home in Atom Universe (AU). The creators of AU, Atom Republic, previously created content for PS Home, but after PS Home was shut down in March 2015, they asked the community what they should do next and the overwhelming response was to build a new virtual world as a successor to PS Home and hence the idea of Atom Universe was born. Atom Republic had a Kickstarter campaign for the game in April 2015 to help fund the development of the intial release which was successful. Atom Republic has partnered with several former 3rd party developers for PS Home such as Engine Giant, Game Mechanics, JAM Games, PS Talent (of which I am a long time member), and more to come. Patrick O'Luanaigh, CEO of nDreams, was also made the AU team's non-executive director during the summer of 2015. He has referred to Atom Universe as the successor to PS Home." Since PS Home's closure
date: many former PS Home developers have created their own game
recommended: but Atom Republic is the only one to have partnered with others. The game is developed with Unreal Engine 4 and features amazing realistic graphics and supports cross-play between PC and PS4 with the potentional to be supported on other platforms (Mac
voteText: etc.)
votesHelpful: e.g. PS5. The game will also support Virtual Reality with such headsets as PlayStation VR for PS4 and Oculus Rift for PC. Atom Republic has been very responsive to feedback from its community and IMO done an excellent job with this project. As a reward for my donation level to the game's Kickstarter that I mentioned
votesTotal: I was given the opportunity to test the Alpha version of the game
votesFunny: which I have been doing for several months now. During this time
commentsCount: I have seen a lot of progress made on the game's development as new features have been added and various bugs fixed. The Early Access version was just made available to backers of the project this past Saturday
column17: which includes a space which we have not seen in the Alpha called Arcade Plaza. Here's a promotional video that shows what the Arcade Plaza looks like: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ftGDFQCRVCs The Early Access version will later be made available to the entire Steam Community but until then
column18: backers like myself will continue to test it. Whether you are looking for a successor to PS Home or a new realistic social game/virtual world in which to play then Atom Universe is for you. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME!!!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There isn't really much to say about this game, because there isn't actually anything to do. You can litterly only do bowling, and sit on some chairs. For a game that's supposed to come out in 3 months, it's really concerning. Everything is either coming soon or a concept art gallery. You can colour your avatar too so that's cool I guess, but there is nothing to do.

Just one question for the devs:
Why would you release a game in this state? It's basically committing steam suicide.

Quick side note: Game runs fine on high for me, running an R9 290 at ~60fps most of the time, but really, for a game with this little to do, it should run fine.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rushed out the door with almost no features.

The way they showcase this game is completely misleading with photos showing off parts of the game which are completely missing. Whats in this build you say?

One room and Bowling. Bowling in which you have to pay real money to play. Theres nothing here. The game clearly wasn't ready for release you just walk around this empty room and look at signs that say coming soon probably?"

I have no clue why they would put out a game with no features. This pretty much feels like they learned Unreal in 2 months and then made this in 2 weeks.

Wait until this actually has features before you try."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I get it, this is in Early Access, it even has a HUGE disclaimer at the start talking about bugs.
That is fine. What is not fine, and what I don't understand, is why you would release the game to receive negative reviews when the ONE THING that you CAN do in the game (Bowling) is buggy and doesn't work.
Minecraft didn't launch into Early Access with pickaxes that didn't mine. Basically the game worked perfectly.
Make sure your game has SOMETHING, anything that works WELL before you release it or expect it to not do well. People are not going to Keep checking in." to see new features when the ones that are present barely work.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nhmmm.....how is this even a game? Nothing to do, I can't understand the point of it. The images and video oversell it to be some cool social gaming experience, well your far from it. For a game to come out in 3 months, it is not ready. Simply because it is boring and weird. Graphics are cool and the idea might be good but you need to give us gamers something to look forward to not a bowlin experience which on my windows 8 PC didnt even work. Also to quit the game I had to hold Ctr+Alt+Delete to close it with task manager, and I have a really decent laptop for gaming. Not worth the installation wait. Froze my whole computer too, too heavy to operate.  Also how is this a theme park featured with fun? I swear from the looks of this game I thought it was gonna be sims but a play park lmao. Not reccomending this until it gets better to run and actually have things to do.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI feel that they've released this game a bit too early there's hardly anything to do it. It would've been best it they finished a bit more and had more to offer on EA release date already it's put a rather bad taste on people. I think reason for them releasing it so early is either trying to build up a player base/community, monitor social interaction and how they can improve upon it, or trying to get some early profit through microtransactions (hopefully not the last one). This game already has a pretty well established community of followers and Kickstarters they could've waited before EA release with a bit more. If you were a regular user of Playstation Home back on the PS3 before it's shutdown you know why this exists but to anyone who is new you'll probably be a bit turned away from it. In the game's current state I can't really recommend it to anyone because like fore mentioned just not enough to show for to really past a sensible amount of judement in my opinion.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a god idea, but the level that it was executed is horrible.
The creator hada good vision in creating this game, and i understand that it is in early access so it is buggy, but it just was not that fun.
It takes six seconds for your message to send to someone, yes i counted.
The graphics were ok and my character had a nice rack so i enjoyed that.
The dance floor has some dank tunes which was swagging.
I was kind of disappointed of the inability to jump so i could not commit suicide which would have been more fun than this game.
The sitting simulator worked better than the bowling simulator.
All in all, it was a game that has potential, but it was poorly executed, but if the developer fixes some of these things, it could be a good game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm reviewing the game as it is at this point in time, not the game that might have been promised for the future.

At the time of review, there is literally nothing to do.

All of the games are labelled as 'Coming Soon' and are thus unplayable. The only accessible game seems to be the bowling game, but you need unobtainable currency in order to play it, so technically that is inaccessible as well. The chat system doesn't work either, so it is pointless to even try to do anything in this game at the moment.

In relation to the current game design, I must say that the menu system is irritating. Having to wait for the menu to float in and out of view seems pointless, and it adds needless delay.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAtom Universe has a lot of potential. But the controls feel unnatural. Graphics look great, but the movement of avatars, the menus, and the physics need some work. AU is still in it's early alpha phase so we really can't judge it too harshly yet. Devs are still working on this and are really just testing how well things work out with players in game. So I suggest that everyone give this a try and then put your feedback on their forums so they can improve the game. There's really no reason not to recommend a game that is still in progress lol. Test it out, thumbs it up so others will want to test it out, and leave the devs feedback so they can improve! :D

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI was a very active PS Home player which was a virtual space full of life and no matter what, there was always something to do, it was a wild yet awesome ride! When I heard about Atom Universe coming to the scene and that its like PS Home, I just had to check it out and so far, I am not dissapointed! :D In this open beta early access so far you can go to the Arcade Plaza and play bowling which is soon to have a multiplayer! The people here so far are friendly and most are from PS Home like myself so its great how we can all meet up here and soon, we'll all be able to explore the park once it opens and start racing, bumper cars, go on the big wheel, log flumes maybe even prize machines! :D Another thing to mention is that the ps home artists are helping out, cool right? This game defo has potential and can defo see the game along with the fanbase growing overtime and I will continue to support it as it goes along as this game is pretty much, PS Home reborn! If you are a player of that game or just like soicilising and having fun in a Virtual Space, this game is defo for you as I loved PS Home and loving this I guess you say reboot of it so far, bring on AU! :D See you in AU! c: Update: there is now a new Hub area and more to come in the future!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

this is a review of the early alpha . . .  0.1.2.4101. Currently, it allows bowling and sitting.  Please do not expect anything past a virtual lounge at this time.  It *is* an **early** alpha.

That said, well done!  I have a low end machine, a Toshiba Satellite with 4 GB ram. The environement rendered well, including particle effects and the neon holograms.   I like the lay out of the lobby and the general atmosphere. I think the horse hologram is great!

I was expecting WASD/Half Life type controls,  If I a virtual klutz like me can navigate, so can you.

I see it has potential although there need to be more into it. I have i7-4770 overclocked to 3.8 ghz with msi r9 280x overclocked and can't hit constant 60 fps on high settings and my graphics card was hitting 70 degrees. Moreover I couldn't find where is the sound options etc, maybe I am dumb or there is no sound options. When I went to play bowling I had no money and could not do anything as it said coming soon"... And lastly for whatever reason I couldn't change character appearance as it was loading.

What you could add:
-Cars
-Open World
-Give a bit of everyone some money at the start
-Ability to have your own house
It may sound like Grand Theft Auto but I want it more of new technology way as there is a feeling as you were in space which is really nice and that options at the start are really nice.

What you should do ASAP:
-Optimize game for better smoothness
-Make those machines finally working instead of saying "coming soon"

If you will make those changes or at least some of them to the point that there will be something to do in this game
date: I will be happy to spend my time playing it. :D"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bowling physics are amazing, avatar selection is great.

Yes this is sarcasm.

Long story short, it does not lie when it says early access. Would be better to come back when it's more complete. I can see potential in this, the only reason for my own thumbs up. If this was a complete waste of time though I wouldn't have given it any attention. The bowling physics do need some tweaking I would think, I struggled with the controls a bit too much too, and the avatar selection is rather lacking. But still, this is a very early access game, and I cannot give it a thumbs down in good faith, better to wait until the game is more complete to give a more in depth review.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAlright so most of the bugs are now gone. The xbox 360 controller on it has almost the same maping as a ps4 just you can use both keyboard and mouse with controller on it. It does use at least 1gb on memory if you use it on high settings. With that said. I would suggest you update you drivers as well as defrag your pc. Clean out your cookies as well in the network settings. Some have already used this on Windows 10. I don't have windows 10 and can not say how really it plays. I have the following, Windows 7 ultimate, Intell Core I7 4770 32gigs of Ram SSD as my operating drive, 1 tb western Digital hdd, Nvidia GTX 960. When I wrote the review the first time I had less memory. For anyone that are having a issue with frame rate issues. Reinstall the driver or look at the minium specs to run this. Alot of times it will do with your hardware or a software not liking the Virtial World. Anti Virus programs as well as your firewall will play into part of alot of things. If you need help contact Atom Universe or cheak and see if you have all the updates for you pc as well.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I first saw the trailer for this I thought this was going to be one of those virtual online social type of programs much like the one they had in PS Home.. Read up a bit on it and it's from the same people? Anyways, upon launching it you get 4 options: Game, User, Settings, and Social; Social doesn't work. The only features you'll be able to do is customize your character with very limited choices(just color and if you want a skimpier outfit for females,) and go to the arcade where you can just stand in the middle of the dance floor or go bowling for a price of 10 ingame currency. Ah.. you can also view images of the private spaces that you may get when it becomes available.

In the end this game doesn't have much to offer as of right now, but I did enjoy the edm playing in the public space. It reminds me of an empty version of Avakin(you can't even play internal games on this one, so Atom Universe has points in that category) for the mobile, and with games like these it needs to be filled with players to even consider to be fun. This IS a social game afterall. Wait a bit until they release more content, it'll get better, and for that reason I recommend it.

I expect more customizations, clothings, and actions. Hopefully the game's community will grow further. Keep it up.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAtom Universe, im havign a hard time describing it without comparing it to pPlaystation home, except with 99 percent less content. At the moment I really think Atom Universe needs a lot more work put in given that all you can really do is sit in chairs or go bowling. There are tons of previews and coming soon signs though so it looks like they have a good deal of things planned. I think the biggest issue will be player base, for a game like Atom Universe, even if you have a lot of things to do, it wont matter if no one is playing, activities does not a social multiplayer game make. I see a good foundation here, but only time will tell how it turns out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought a new laptop and got to try Atom it for the first time, so my laptop is super low-end (Radeon R5) which probably gave me the laggy experience, I got like 10-15fps on high settings as opposed to 30fps on low, I can't say much about graphics as i don't have a gaming PC, just a very basic AMD laptop, so I'll cover the other areas.

+ Bowling, clearly inspired by Home and modified into a unique mechanic, it's setting is basically Home's bowling alley mixed with Singstar, feels cramped and I think it would benefit from another floor, some hallways, etc. whatever makes it feel less like a hollow box (Motorstorm is a good example of a fun layered space)
+ Western art design that I find crazy amazing because it's so cool, mature and unique, no kawaii desu~ crap here, it's a little cartoonish so that gives it a unique style and a fun aesthetic, like an evolution over Home's slightly cartoonier art design
+ Looks promising, like there's a very long journey ahead of it's growth process
+ The music is cool
---
- 99% of everything you want to see or do (even dances/poses) says Coming Soon so it's like the game's in Early Early Pre-Alpha Build v0.02
- The characters awkwardly lean forward while standing
- My character ran like she was a guy being chased by bees

I think Atom Republic's just looking for critique on this community-based product, so here's what I would like to see fixed/incorporated, I think it'll be a quality product, hopefully better than Home was, but that won't be for quite a while, until then I await it's completion, I think I can recommend it conventionally, for now wait til it's at least beta.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPersonally this reminds me of playstation home and I really loved it. But this game/3D world is no where near as good as playstation home. The only updates are small baby updates and most of the time it takes months for 1 update to fix a few bugs and add a small amount of new stuff. Also the recent update that i have had makes the game crash every time i go into a room (ex. The Hub) and thats kind of really annoying. I really don't see why the developers would have made an early access version of this game when there is very very little to do. In my opinion they should've waited till they had alot more to do like personal houses, a handful of places to go and explore, mini-games in each area, pets, clothes, ect. and i feel like at this rate when they do release the real thing it might end up as a poor cash grab but who knows only time can tell.
